Package infodynamics.measures.continuous.kraskov

Class OInfoCalculatorKraskov

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.continuous.MultiVariateInfoMeasureCalculatorCommon
      • infodynamics.measures.continuous.kraskov.MultiVariateInfoMeasureCalculatorKraskov
        • infodynamics.measures.continuous.kraskov.OInfoCalculatorKraskov
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InfoMeasureCalculatorContinuous, java.lang.Cloneable
    public class OInfoCalculatorKraskov
extends MultiVariateInfoMeasureCalculatorKraskov
implements java.lang.Cloneable

    Computes the differential O-information of a given multivariate set of observations, using Kraskov-Stoegbauer-Grassberger (KSG) estimation (see Kraskov et al., below).

    Usage is as per the paradigm outlined for MultiVariateInfoMeasureCalculatorCommon.

    Finally, note that Cloneable is implemented allowing clone() to produce only an automatic shallow copy, which is fine for the statistical significance calculation it is intended for (none of the array data will be changed there).

    References:

    • Rosas, F., Mediano, P., Gastpar, M., Jensen, H., "Quantifying high-order effects via multivariate extensions of the mutual information".
    • Kraskov, A., Stoegbauer, H., Grassberger, P., "Estimating mutual information", Physical Review E 69, (2004) 066138.
    Author:
    Pedro A.M. Mediano (email, www)

    • Method Detail

      • partialComputeFromObservations

        protected double[] partialComputeFromObservations​(int startTimePoint,
                                                  int numTimePoints,
                                                  boolean returnLocals)
                                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from class: MultiVariateInfoMeasureCalculatorKraskov
        Protected method to be used internally for threaded implementations. This method implements the guts of each Kraskov algorithm, computing the number of nearest neighbours in each dimension for a sub-set of the data points. It is intended to be called by one thread to work on that specific sub-set of the data.

        Child classes should implement the computation of any specific measure using this method.

        The method returns:

        1. for average measures (returnLocals == false), the relevant sums of digamma(n_x+1) in each marginal for a partial set of the observations
        2. for local measures (returnLocals == true), the array of local values
        Specified by:
        partialComputeFromObservations in class MultiVariateInfoMeasureCalculatorKraskov
        Parameters:
        startTimePoint - start time for the partial set we examine
        numTimePoints - number of time points (including startTimePoint to examine)
        returnLocals - whether to return an array or local values, or else sums of these values
        Returns:
        an array of sum of digamma(n_x+1) for each marginal x, then sum of n_x for each marginal x (these latter ones are for debugging purposes).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
